page.title: 08Small Businesses in Darwen
page.content: { Frank Millington}came to Darwen in the early 1970's to make{plastic {mouldings}- it seemed 'the business of the future';there were few{plastics firms in Darwen. Many firms had moved to Darwen because{low rates}were offered after the decline of the{cotton}industry; most firms today seem to be set up by local people. He has had an{electronics}firm but now has a{paint and stripping}business in{Premier Mill,}manufactures{picture {frames}and high quality{wooden toys and executes{pyrography}on wood.He has always used{old mills}for premises. Better grants would be available to him on Merseyside but{aid}does go to those who set up in old mills. Despite heavy paperwork,he believes that smallfirms have a future due to low overheads.
